intro: Galium huancavelicum, commonly known as the Huancavelica bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom during the warmer months. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Galium huancavelicum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
